text: Tap. Grassy grain and malt. Spicy and thick. Very yeasty but not altogether tasty.

A hazed amber Bock with a thin off white head. In aroma, nice grassy malt with light fruity esters, light wild yeast, light barnyard and a hint of curacao. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light mineral notes, light Brett, light curacao, interesting after all these years.

Keg at Brewdog shepherds Bush. A translucent deep golden orange coloured pour with fine e white head. Aroma is big sweet banana bread, cinnamon, spicy notes, phenolic. Flavour is composed of soft bready malts, amber, banana bread, honey, bread loaf. Palate is frorhy, rounded,, semi sweet,. Little alcohol in the finish.

330 mml bottle as part of the European Local Swap 2/2017, many thanks RW80 for this one. Cloudy golden colour with an off white head. Aroma of sweet malts, some caramel, coriander and yeast. Taste is light herby and fruity with a low bitterness finish. Next one please!

Sampled draft @ t Taphuys. Golden, creamy white head. Nose is esters, poorly BE heavy, cleaning products, so much soap & banana, painful,... Taste is so much banana, soap, esters, overly BE in a bad way, near phenolic, BE esters, so BE, hard to drink in bad ways, almost alcoholic,... Body is BE yeast, awful soap,... Soo BE, banana, soap,... Painful to drink. High score on here baffles me.
At Home amber colored body with a white head and with a spicy fruity malt hop aroma a spicy fruity malt hop sweet bitter taste with a bitter finish
Gedronken met Simon en Quinten, smaakt naar laurierdrop, licht blond biertje, niet heel bijzonder maar wel prima doordrinkbaar
UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Bottle. Color: Golden to amber, white head. Medium sweet, hints of yeast, caramel and licorice. Flowery. OK beer, but lacking something special
Orange colour: just as suitable for Kings Day as Easter. Coriander and orange zest. Subtle and smooth, soft beer.
Ruikt lekker hoppig en ziet er prima uit. Smaakt aardig, gewoon lekker fris biertje.
Drinkt makkelijk, maar valt qua smaak wat tegen. Beetje waterig, verder niet heel uitgesproken.

This beer is rated as early spring bock by the brewery. 
This beer was full of surprises.
The appearance is nice golden with a rock solid dense head. Taste is fresh with a little sweetness, but only very little sweetness. Nice in balance. Not fast drinkimg but to enjoy! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flesje; beetje goudachtig van kleur, goed, maar geen adembenemend opvallend bier.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: clear light amber with medium white head. Aroma: coriander, banana, clove, spices. Taste: medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of coriander, clove, unripe banana, yeast and spices. Palate: medium bodied, oily to sticky texture and lively carbonation.

Pours dark golden with a minor white head. Grainy, malty aroma with a faint yeasty and metallic touch. Tastewise on the sweeter side, with a clear bananaish yeasty touch. Clear hops and grain. Some fruity tones as well. Moderately bitter, with a mildly sweet, somewhat dry finish. Bit of a warming tone in the aftertaste. Sticky texture, medium bodied, average carbonation. Decent brew, nothing special either.

Aroma: fruitig, gist, moutig.

Smaak: typisch lentebok smaak(lastig te omschrijven) fruitig, mout en wat gist.

Beetje stroperig mondgevoel.
Thnx to JP. Pours clear yellowamber. Small white head. Smell is german yeast. Taste is mild bitter, bit german yeast, ok. Bit sweet.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 De geur is niet geweldig maar de kleur de perfecte paasei om voor Pasen te verstoppen. Een mooie gele kleur met een troubeling erin. Veel CO2 wat een goeie schuimkraag van kleine belletjes maakt die ook niet meteen weg is. Het heeft een fruitige en best zoetige smaak.Maar bittertje net als de hop is ver te zoeken heel in de verte nemen we dat waar. Naar mijn smaak iets te zoet maar als je van paasbrood met spijs houdt dan ben je een zoetekauwer dan is dit biertje zeker je ding. De naam is helemaal briljant. Helaas voor het eerst vindt ik het echt jammer dat ik voor originaliteit van de naam geen punten kan geven. Paas-ij wie verzint dat nou? Vooruit misschien als je brouwerij het IJ heet en je wilt een biertje voor Pasen brouwen....
ruikt zurig als van een kruidenboeket in de dronk komt hier een aangenaam bitter en in de wals een zoetje

12/XI/16 - 33cl bottle @ home - BB: II/2017 (2016-1298) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, creamy yellowish head, irregular, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: pretty sourish, rhubarb jam, bit dirty, yeasty, pears, is this infected? MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very yeasty start, malts, lots of grains, banana peel. Aftertaste: spicy, coriander, yeast, soft bitterness.

Light amber, white thick head.
Freshly ground malt, slightly citrussy, hay.
Medium sweet, soft carbonation. Doesnt seem to have 7 % Alcohol. A very drinkable Bock! Nice.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, yeast, grain, orange, hops and spices.

Appearance:

Hazy/turbid golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, yeast and orange; ends slightly/medium dry with grain and hops.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Slightly too sweet and dry without many flavours to back this up; still amazing though.
Golden with a medium white head. Aroma is wheat, lime and herbs. Taste is grain, herbs and biscuit.
Bottle at home, 22nd May 16. Pours amber, aroma is sweet, malt, slight hops. Taste is sweet, but refreshing and very drinkable, liked this

33cl bottle at home. Pours a clear orange colour with a decent frothy white head on top which leaves lacing. Aroma of caramel, malts, coriander, spices. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a dry bitter finish. notes of spices, malts, grass, nutmeg, yeast. Texture is sticky, medium bodied with average carbonation.

In bottle. A very good surprise. I was reluctant to drink it, but its a good beer. Medium white head, not very fizzy. Strong coriander smell. Very sweet and oily tongue. I see it as a light Tripel Karmeliet

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2017 Aus der Flasche der Knaller (ca.2Euro/0,33l aus dem Braushop). Der helle Bock zuerst kaum erkennbar. Belgisch, hoppy kommt es daher und erst beim Trunk mischt sich die typische Süße unter den extravaganten Trunk. Der Nachhall ist dann abgefahren. Intensiv, hoppy, tripelig und klar süß. HEISS!!!!! Die beiden Male die ich es vom Hahn probiert habe waren nicht so intensiv, aber trotzdem solide (HET ELFDE GEBOD, Amsterdam 0,33l/4,80 und direkt im TIJ Brewpub 0,3/ca.2Euro). 2017er Edition vomn Hahn im Flamingo Amsterdam.... 8/4/8/4/18 FRESH FAT STUFF :). A HELLER BOCK MASTERPIECE!! Verspielt belgisch, floral hoppy und unwiderstehlich süffig. Extravagant&HOT;!!
From bottle. Pours clear Amber. Aromas of toasted malts, burnt toffee. Savoury and sweet on the palate, chocolate and nuts.

Bottle at Appellation Wines tasting. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Faint lacing. Aroma of bay leaf, lime chutney and yeast. Flavour of bread, honeyed malt and sweetcorn. Medium body with an oily mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Interesting aroma but it tastes overly sweet.
Hazy deep orange, huge foamy white head. Aroma is spicy t ij yeast, slightly malty. Flavor is bitter spicy, quite malty, yeasty and thick body. Not very outspoken, still OK.
Découverte via la Saveur Box. Bière dorée très fruitée au nez comme en bouche. Belle découverte et très bon moment.
At t IJ, Amsterdam. Slightly opaque golden yellow, creamy white head. Belgian yeast aroma. Creamy alcohol-rich body. Soft sip. Just ok.
Bottle at appellation. Pours golden, nose is burnt toffee, sausage, grassy, taste is sweet, sticky toffee, grassy, lemon.
Bottle at Comely Bankers III. Golden with some sediments. Nose is fruits, honey, floral. Taste is sweet honey, fruits, toffee. Sweet but also fruity.

Bottle thanks to Nihtila.
Appearance - golden with a decent head. 
Nose - sweetcorn wrapped in toffee.
Taste - orange and light bitterness.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a fairly good finish. 
Overall - interesting and solid.
Bottle at Comely Bankers III, The Search For Bock. Pours golden with a few floaters and a thin white head. Aromas of malt, sweetcorn, toffee. Taste is creamy toffee. Sweet finish
Malty aroma. Copper. Some saison similiarities. Limonade palate. Some spices. Dusty malts.

Hazy copper color. Medium white head. Aroma of fruits, coriander, spicies, malt and earthy hops. Flavours of yellow fruits, coriander, earthy hops. Malty slightly bittet finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bitter and clean with a well rounded deep flavour. Tastes better in Amsterdam I think. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Hennie Berendsen, Enschede. It pours mostly clear golden with a white head. Malty and earthy hoppy aroma. The flavor is deep malty with a clean earthy hoppy finish. Light spicy.

30cl draught at the brewpub on 20-Mar-2016. Hazy orange amber colour with a medium sized tan coloured head. Aroma of sweet malt, dark fruits, warm spices and yeast which follow through on tasting. Light floral hops and full flavoured. Medium body and carbonation. Nice seasonal.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 Donkergeel helder bier. Behoorlijke schuimkraag die snel zakt (wit). Geur als een Belgisch bierte.....Belgische gist, scherp, koriander. Die gisting proef je ook direct.... Zoetig en wat kruidig. Aardige bitter....blijft ook even hangen. Daarna voornamelijk kruidig en zoet. Veel koolzuur en ook een volle body. Erg lekker. Maar lentebier? Vind het meer een Belgisch pintje.

The beer has a very nice look. The color is a perfect golden yellow. It is very shiny, and sunny. It really looks like Easter. The beer has a little cloudiness. Not as cloudy as I aspected from an unfiltered beer. The beer pours a decent amount of crispy white foam. The foam is a little rough, and collapses quickly. The smell is a little simple, a little mild. There is a fresh bitter hop aroma, that is nice and springy. Taste is good, good bitterness and delicious fresh slightly sour hops. Little floral taste. Nice spring like taste. Smell is to mild. Taste is quite familiar. I dont know what it reminds me of, but it is very nice. It is perfect for our Easter family dinner.

Golden pour, medium frothy head, clear. A: strong malts, herbal citrus, nettle. T: medium herbal, sweet malts, medium bitter development with biscuit notes, fruity yeast. Fruity bitter finish. Very Belgian.

33cl bottle. Pale amber, clear, with a white head. Smells like yeast, yeast spices and faint sourness. Bitter-sweet and metallic taste, with notes of honey, herbal hops, spices. Actually quite enjoyable.

Draft 0.3l at the Brewpub Brouwerij  t Ij Amsterdam Netherlands. Taste with bro luttonm and Jelena.26.02.2016.Pour it hazy almost clear orange color with medium white head.Aroma of spices, fruits, apples definitely. Taste sweet fruity, apples, peach, pear, lots of different kind of spices, finish again with sweet note.Nice balanced good eastern beer.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, 2016 version. Clear, golden yellow with a thin, fluffy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish, spicy and slightly floral aroma of massive coriander and licorice, accompanied by a bit of vanilla and peach or banana. Sweetish, very spicy and minimally floral taste of coriander, licorice, vanilla and sugar, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Too spicy for me, reminds me a lot of IJndejaars, and not in a good way. Still quite okay of course, but nothing I would want to drink another bottle of.
Thuis van de fles. Lekker met coriander en gist smaakjes. En net op tijd nog. Backlog from 2015/04/06.
Bottle at home. Very nice ale. Orange colour, foamy head. Buttery, sweet taste. Hint of chocolate. Perfumey finish. Enjoyable, especially in April...
Flaska från Saveur Bieré. Smak och doft av humle, malt, jäst, hö, ladugård örtiga toner och koriander. Fruktig, oljig, lagom söt, fin beska.

Bottle from saveure-biere: Golden, unclear color, very small white head. Malt and honey aroma, citrus hops, caramel, yeast. Flavor is bready, malty, light caramelic, lemon hops, herbal bitterness. Bit unusual lemon flavor and not so blanced but nevertheless tasty.

330ml bottle at Café van Daele, Amsterdam:
This one wasnt a bad effort from t IJ although I didnt enjoy it anywhere near as much as I did their Zatte tripel. This one had quite an unusual aroma that I couldnt quite place at times but the taste wasnt a bad one at all & overall the balance of the beer was pleasant with some bitterness at the end to counter the sweetness that featured throughout. An easy enough beer to drink & one that Im glad I tried, particularly as its a spring seasonal but Im not sure its one that Id pick again.

Colour: Bright gold. Medium to thin white head.
Nose: Wheat, lemon zest, herbs. Hints of vanilla and citrus.
Flavours: Fresh, lemon, vanilla, herbs, grains, biscuits.
Finish: Medium long and thirst-quenching.
Verdict: One of the finest Lentebock beers of 2015

fles 33cl
kleur goudgeel, niet helder, kleine witte schuimkraag
geur mout en licht zoet fruit
smaak licht zoet, licht bitter, beetje vlak

330ml bottle from Saveur.Biere.com. Pours hazy orange with decent white head. Aroma brings sweet spice. Taste is similar with lots of sweet sherbetty flavours, candi sugar, bright fruit and a nice sparkle. Nice.
Slightly hazy orange with a dense, creamy head. Tangy taste with very slight bitterness. Aroma is typical blonde. Overly carbonated.

Barwa to głębokie złoto, piana obfita, długo utrzymuje się cieniutką warstwą. 
Aromat to mieszanka ziołowo-przyprawowych drożdży i intensywnej kolendry.
Piwo jest lekko słodkie, a pierwsze skrzypce graja słody. Gdzieś tam po chwili pojawia się kolendra i lekkie posmaki żółtych owoców, coś jak morele i mirabelki. Finisz to zaskakująco mocna i dość długo zostająca na podniebieniu ziołowo-drożdżowa goryczka, troszkę tępa w posmaku. Alkohol jest dobrze ukryty.

Bottle 33cl. Yellow amber coloured with a small white head that fades quickly. Little Co2. Aroma not very explicit. Malts and yeast, but only hints. The taste is much like blonde beer: a mild sweetness and an even milder bitterness. Not bad, but nothing special.
Mooie oranje kleur in het glas. Schuimkraag verdwijnt helaas gelijk. Het bier is lekker fris, smaak blijft lang hangen.

330 ml bottle. #010. THT 02/2015. From bierzwerg.de.
Cloudy golden colour with a tiny white head. 
Belgian yeast, mild sweetness, citrus, malt and some play doh... in the aroma I mean. 
The flavour is bready malt, yeast, mild bitterness, citrus and some mild alcohol. Najaa...
Unclear orange colored beer with a good white head. Taste is yeast, nice bitter hops and sweet fruit. Good balance, nice.

33cl flesje via Gall en Gall, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 7%
Uitgeschonken in Grimbergen glas

Uiterlijk: amberkleurig, amper schuim

Aroma en smaak: kruidig, Belgisch gist, fruitig als citrus, moutig

Conclusie: fris biertje, jammer van het schuim, niet slecht 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Dirk III in Hardinxveld. The beer is golden to amber colored and pours a large white head, with a lot of bubbles. The aroma is fruity and spicy (coriander like), yeast, spring flowers and hops. The taste is full and light sweet (tones of candy and fruits) to change into a nice bitterness with tones of roasted malts and spices. The finish is long and refreshing, with a long staying bitterness. 
Finally a Heller Bock from Holland, which is actually good.
330ml Bottle - Amber in colour. Coriander and yeast dominate in the aroma. Spicy, yeasty and slightly sweet taste with notes of coriander, ginger and dried apricot.
Very nice mixture of aromas and a very lovely fresh beer. I truly enjoyed it.
Pours a dark orange color with a small creamy white head. Dough, yeast and herbs. Spicy and dry.

Bottle, BBE 31/01/15. Pours orange with a classy, off-white head. Aroma is pale malts, grainy, honey, some flower. Taste is grainy, somewhat flowery, fairly sweet, some spiciness. Fairly light with medium carbonation. Feels rather like a bock.

Een oranjegeel bier met aardige schuimkraag. Geur van gist en koriander. Smaak is licht bitter en licht zoet, gist, beetje citrus. Afdronk is bitter, die lekker lang blijft hangen. Prettige Belgian Ale.

Bottle from the Bierkoning. Poured a hazy light amber with a big frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, big citrus fruit. The flavour is moderate bitter, light sweet with a fresh, crisp citrus fruit, orange peel, light spice palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Very huge, dense yellowish head, very slowly collapsing over very hazy orange-amber beer. Bit oppressive, sweet-milky smell, superimposed by a raw hoppy aroma, as from wild hops. Warming up, the coriander makes itself known. Corianderbomb. Spicy, lightly peppery, dried herbs (and hops) and fake citrus. Thick, slick MF, slightly burning feel; traces of alcohol. In fact, I loathe this.

Bottle. Yellow hazy. Belgy yeasty, some corny popcorny malts, bit of citrus, belgy yeasty. Fullish med body, nice texture. Dries off the tongue, but has pale sweetness. Good pale malts, just a hint of greeny continental hops. Pretty nice balanced belgian ale.
Bottle @ Nedre Mölla 9/7-14. Aroma: Yeast, malty, brett(?), fruity. Taste: Dito + orange/citrus. The finish is dry and bitter.
Bottle @ Nedre Mölla 9/7-14. Malty, fruity and spicy, some barnyard notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and yeasty.

Bottle: Deep golden, hazy, small and stable white head; almost solid yeasty-fruity and caramelly nose with slight hoppy traces; robust sweet-bitter, including a little tartness, medium bodied; traces of alcohol in the sweetish-fruity and yeasty finish, increasing hoppiness in the aftertaste. Good
bottle from Bierzwerg. Hazy golden colour, lovely fruity nose. Full-bodied, malty with nice hops, fruity and spicy with a peppery touch. Good.
Decent easter beer. Belgian style yeasty body, with all kinds of fruits and herbs.

Nice, very tasty!!! limited edition
bokbier for Easter; not too sweet, thereby producing a fine flavour. The flavour and aromas give a nicely balanced mix of fruit, coriander, yeast and hops.

Ok beer. Not great. I had better from this brewer. The taste is mostly yeast, malt and sweetness. There is some herbs and a metallic element. Somehow it feels like it should have been a stronger heavier beer. It is not realy refreshing but also does not have real power.
Bottle at home. Pours amber with a white head. Medium sweet malty aroma. Bit of spiciness. Taste is malty, bit sweet. Some hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice.

(bottle, 33cl) Almost cloudy, golden colour with a mid-sized off-white foamy head. Yeasty, slightly sourish citrus-fruity aroma with delicately grainy malty accents and traces of vanilla. Slightly sweet-bitter, also delicately sour flavour, medium to light bodied with a modest carbonation. Dry-ish malt character with citrus fruity notes, traces of caramel, yeasty and slightly peppery spice; quite dry malt-accented finish with vaguely nutty notes and shades of citrus and grapefruit. Not an everyday darling but pleasant to drink. 08.IV.14

A slightly brown, yellow beer, a head is big and white. The nose is fruitfull and fresh, citrusfruits, fruitesters, apples, spices and some sourness. Taste is strongly fruitfull, lemon, lots of spices and also quite strong bitterness. Also the white part under the orange skin are found in the end. Medium bodied, high and sparkling carbonation that it OK even for me, that is enhancing the refreshness. Good beer, lots of spices, citrusfruits and even bitterness.

Licht pittig randje op koekjes en zoetzuur, wat ombuigt naar fijn bittertje in nasmaak. Aroma van bloemen en koekjes, met kruiden er doorheen verweven. Licht bruisend in de mond, kraak blijft op donkeroranje troebel.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours hazy orange with white head. 
Aroma yeast, citrus, fruits, malts, spice. 
Taste malty sweets, nice spicy fresh bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
Nice spring beer.

hazy dark orange colour, huge, though not too dense off-white head, which collapses within a few minutes; aroma of yeast, citruses, hints of caramel, earthy notes and hay; taste of yeast, minimal citrus, bread and caramel, sulphuric notes and spicy aftertaste; dry mouthfeel - really good belgian ale, I like it!
Gerichtlich recht süß, fruchtig, erinnert an Weintrauben. Start süß, Gewürze. Mitte süßlich, würzig. Abgang bitter, leicht malzig und gewürzt. In Ordnung.
Good beer and taste. Lighter but not too light on the palate. Overall a good beer. A must buy when in Amsterdam!
bottle a dark golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts fruits white fruits citrus spicy and hops flavor malts citrus white fruits spicy and hops in the finish
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes dunkelgoldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, sehr würzig, leicht fruchtig, blumig. Geschmack würzig malzig, hefig, Gewürze, Gemüse, leicht fruchtig.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 33 cl bottle
Appearance: Vey Light hazy  dark orange with a very small head less then a finger and quite some action..
Aroma: Yeast, citrus, iron and coriander
Taste: Sweet and bitter. Yeast, citrus, herbs and coriander , the aftertaste is a quite spicey  mainly bitterness.

medium body, soft carbonation.

Old review was 3-2-7-13. Due to an odd Sulphuric tones and aroma. - Off bottle ?
33cl bottle from BierNavigatie. Pale orange with a medium white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sweet and bitter. Yeast, citrus, orange, herbs and hops. A refreshing spring brew.

33cl [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Head: off-white foam. Colour: hazy brass. Aroma: citrus hops, some fruit, recognisable yeast. Taste: mild bitter-sweet. Palate: dry, mild bitter-sweet, medium CO2, lasting body. Overall: nice.

Draught at Onder de Ooievaar, Amsterdam
Hazy orange with a white head. 
Yeasty and spicy aroma. 
Rather sweet flavour with spices; clove, nutmeg. 
Medium, dry bitterness.
Copper-coloured beer with white foam head. Hoppy aroma. Taste is fruity with a light bitterness in the background.

33cl bottle @ home. Hazy orange copper color medium creamy beige head. Aroma floral, honey, citrus, belgian yeast, slightly roasty, licorice notes. Taste medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light umami. Medium to full body, sticky texture, average carbonation, belgian style bitter-sweet finish, bitterness stays longer in the palate. Good, refreshing, smells really good, but still not very exciting, and far not the best from t IJ.
On tap @ De Drie Dorstige Herten, Utrecht. Hazy golden with a white head. Fruity aroma with a spicy edge. Nice spring beer.
UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 Amber oranje van kleur met een wit luchtige schuimkraag. Smaak citrus en mandarijn allebei op de achtergrond. Licht zurige met een bittertje.
Op de tap bij de 3 dorstige herten, Goudgele kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Test glaasje. Eerste smaakimpressie : hop, bitter. Stevige nasmaak.

33 cl bottle @ HBF 14
Aroma has lots of soapy citrus. Also some distant belgian yeast notes. Flavour has also soapy citrus, some earthy notes. A basic soapy belgian ale with t IJ house flavour added. Dry and leathery finish. Refreshing.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2016 Bottle 33cl. Hazy orange amber, average off-white frothy head, nice lacing; fruity slightly perfumed nose, peaches, mandarin, tart, bread, floral hops, citrus; sweetbitter taste with honey, bit sour at the end; full body, oily texture, soft carbonation; lasting hopbitter finish, well-balanced.
Retasted 16/6/2016. Bottle 33cl. bbd 2/2016. Cloudy medium amber, lot of floaties, small frothy off-white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma roasted malts, caramel, dark bread, fruity, wood, brown sugar; taste medium sweet and bitter, roasted malts, fruity, brown sugar, toffee; roasty sweetbitter aftertaste, bit of wood, spicy notes; medium body, oily texture, average carbonation; far less fruity than the one I tasted on 4/4/2014, this one is strong on the roasted malts. Anyway seems like an other beer altogether, however rating stays the same.
UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Aroma of malts, fruits, spices, yeast, floral notes, coriander. Flavour is fruity and spicy sweetness with some hops and a very slight bitter finish. Very Belgian, very nice.

Hazy orange colour with a slightly off-white head. Aromas a bit too thin, but along with the taste oranges, pineapple, apple and hoppy and malty bitterness are distinguishable. As it warms it gets more sweet (honey). Lively mouthfeel, medium-high carbonated, not too big bodied. Refreshing and balanced but flavourwise not too special.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 Opaque copper orange beer with a generous head and little carbonation.Peaches, mandarin , breadiness on the nose, with some bitter alcoholic woodiness which I?ve come to associate with biological beer. ?t Ij pulls it off nicely thou.Good balance of bitter and watery, refreshing. Full-bodied and nicely fizzy with hints of honey, caramel and some alcohol.Quite a nice beer.
Mooie oranje kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop en iets zoet. Smaakt iets bitter verder vind ik hem wat aan de zoete kant.
Draft. Pours a hazy golden beer with white head. Aroma is spicy, especially cloves. Taste is a thick pallate with al lot of cloves. Medium bitter. A good beer.

Pours a golden orange, a little unclear, with a full, offwhite head. Sweet aroma of honey, apple and bread. Nice taste with a little toffee, some sweetness and a good bitter. Easily drinkable. I like this.
Zoals het t IJ betaamd. Een fris lentebiertje met n vleugje trippel en n hint naar de zomer

(Draught at t IJ, Amsterdam, 28 Feb 2014) Hazy golden amber colour with dense, off-white head. Malty, fruity, spicy nose with notes of dried fruit, citrus, orange peel and spicy hops. Malty, fruity taste with dried fruit, orange peel, apricots, a touch of clove, toast and a certain spicy bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, with a certain sweetness. Spicy and tasty. Quite nice.

At the brewery: Pours a murky golden/brown with an off-white head. Aroma is hoppy in the sense that hops are plant matter and this smells like plant matter. Also, there is some booze in there as it warms up, which was strange considering the relatively low alcohol. Taste is floral hops. There are somewhat darkish malts. Moderate aftertaste. Medium body.

Slightly hazy amber with medium white head. Yeasty, light roasted malts, coriander, hint of cloves. Strong vegetal notes of green beans and unripe fruit. Bittersweet with medium body and slightly watery feel. Nice stuff.

Bottle, month past best before date. Pours murky amber, foaming off white head. Fruity, spicy, warming alcoholic aroma. Fairly sweet taste, raisins, pineapple, honey, herbs, with a nice bitter. Perhaps not special, but a tasty, well balanced beer.

Bottle from the Bierkoning, released at the same time as the first flowers in Hilversum. Dark hazy gold - amber pour with thick creamy, just ever so yellowish white head. Aroma is spicy, quite yeasty, dried grass clippings, fruity notes, perfumy floral alcohol notes as well. Taste is malty, quite spicy, yeasty with a fair amount of alcohol flavors poking through as well. Palate is full bodied, a bit sweet with good carbonation. Heavy belgian ale.

Aroma: Dough, cheese, little citrus, earthy, grass Appearance: Gold, amber, lot of little yeast in there, very soft carbonation, clear white big bubble frothy head, slowly disappearing, medium lace Taste: Grass, spruce, dough, soft carbonation, hint of oranges, minimal cheesy ending

donker amber met witte kraag
aroma: pilsmoutig, zoet
smaken: zwak zoet, redelijk bitter, matig van sterkte, matig gemout, matig kruidig, medium body, dun iets prikkelende co2, afdronk wat hoppig en kruidig. bittertje is aanwezig.
33CL bottle at home, dark orange beer with a white head, aroma is a bit hoppy, taste is the same, light bitter/sour, medium/high carbo, drinkable but nothing special
UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 0,33l fles, meerdere malen gedronken. Licht troebel gouden bier, met een hopbittertje, een zoetje en een zuurtje, citrus en perzik fris en fruitig mooi in balans

Sötétebb arany színű sör, igen ködös belsővel, amin egy igen krémes és kitartó, közepes méretű hab csücsül. Illata édeskés, fűszeres, élesztős és déligyümölcsös. Íze is intenzíven gyümölcsös, mangós, zöld almás, citrusos, élesztős, malátás, rendesen korianderes, fűszeres. Közepesen testes, kicsit sűrű, mérsékelten buborékos. Utóíze édeskés, gyümis, picit száraz. Tényleg van benne valami húsvéti beütés...
Troebel oranjegeel, goede kraag.  Ruikt naar mout en vaag sinaasappelschil. Idem smaak. Vrij bittere droge afdronk.

On tap @ Brouwerij t IJ, Amsterdam. Pours hazy orange with a finger thick creamy head. Aroma is yeasty, with a caramelly hoppy orange peel bitterness to it. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is quite yeasty with a good touch of citrusy hops and zesty orange peel, as well as a good heather honey sweetness. Quite nice.

0,33 bottle. pours hazy amber with big off-white soft head.
light fruity aroma, apple and lemony yeasts, honey notes.
sweet raisins taste, fresh fruits, hazelnuts and umami final. very high carbonation, medium body, pasty mouthfeel.
Bread, caramel, herbs. Smells dry of fresh baked bread with a tad sweetness. Color is nice and deep amber, almost pancake-syrup-like. Flavour is quite sweet with a very slight bitter undertone.

330ml bottle at the brew pub. Aroma is wheat, sweet. Appearance is cloudy brown with a nice white foam. Taste is light sweet an sour. Has a minimal bitter mouth feel and leaves some dryness. Overall a great beer.

Tap at the brewery, Amsterdam.
Cloudy golden appearance with a creamy offwhite head. Yeasty and spicey aroma with some fruits, mango. Medium bodied beer with a spicey character, coriander, green apples.

Unclear, caramel/honeylike colored beer, and a light-brown foamy head. Sweet aroma, which reminds me a bit of apple. It has a slightly bitter and malty taste. The aftertaste switches between bitter and flat-sweet, but is doesnt have a dry ending.

troebel, caramel/honingkleurig bier met een lichtbruine kop. Het aroma is zoetig en lijkt in de verte op appel. De smaak is licht bitter en moutig De nasmak wisselt van bitter naar plat, maar heeft geen droge afdronk.
Pours a nice golden orange beer.  Smells a bit sweet. Fruity. The taste is nice.  A bit sweet and a bit bitter. Nothing to special.

Bottle, 330 ml, at home. Poured into a tulip. ABV 7%.
 Very deep orange colour, hazy, with bits and pieces floating in it. A bit taller than one finger head, white in colour, with average retention and no lacing left on the glass.
Aroma is yeasty, with fruit notes and sugars.
Taste follows the aroma, quite fruity, a bit of yeast, nice mild hoppy bitterness.
Medium body, carbonation just a bit above average. Good dryness on the palate.
Overall, quite nice and enjoyable.

Bottle:
Medium sized, lively and fairly quick changing creamy off white foamy head. Changes into a closed thin lacing on top of a hazy orange colored beer.
Aromas of bread, malts, gass, manure, porridge, grains, glue and cleaner.
Flavours of malts, cream, spices, bread, dough, some creamy spices, some (malty) bitters, some plant extracts.
Aftertaste is malty, floral, bitter and a bit herbal.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium body and a creamy texture.
Not quite balanced and theres some strange bitter and spice tones that make it a bit less interesting.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 2013 - 04 - 02 330ml bottle. orange golden colour. medium, white head. dough, caramel, licorice and alcohol in aroma. bitter-sweet taste

Of course Ive been drinking this since 1986...but not in recent years. Now that the quality of t IJ beers seems to be back on track its time again. Amber hazy color. Firm off white head with good retention. Aromas: caramel, fruity, yeasty, biscuits and spices. Malty sweetness and some tart fruits retronasal. Flavor is only lightly sweet, fruity. Medium bodied. Finishes with a subtle bitterness. Almost like the old days.
Poured a hazy pale amber with a medium white head. Aroma of sweet malt and orange. Medium body, flavour of spice, sweet caramel malt.

Draft at Locus Publicus, Delft.  Pours hazy light orange with an off white head.  Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, light spice and fruit.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

A clear yellow/orange colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of fruits like citrus. Some hops with spices. The taste of sharp malt, with fruits and some hop. The aftertaste is sweet, some spices and bitter notes.
Hazy dark yellow with small white foam head. Aroma is quite bitter with some herbs. Taste is nice hoppy bitter. Long aftertaste. (Velp 201303)

Draught @ t IJ brewpub, Amsterdam. Rated on 25.2.2013.
Pours a hazy orange amber colour with a white creamy head. Aroma of sweetish malts, caramel and grassy hops. Flavour of sweetish malts, strong fresh bitterness, sour berries, caramel and mellow honey-like notes. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a mellow, sweet and quite bitter finish. So fresh, so clean.
Draft at TIJ. Caramel colored pour. Toffee maltiness. Coriander, orange peel, sweet. Good flavor, balanced. Nice beer
030113: Easily cloudy golden beer with a fine foam. A little strong mystical spicy yeast flavor. Special but still very exciting. Aroma of coriander.
Cloudy light gold with a creamy white head. Good Belgian fruity smell, spicy. Slightly boozy warmth, mild bitterness, fruity and malty. Nice.

330 ml bottle @ Håndverkerstuene, thanx to espenra. A hazy orange body with a small off-white head. Aroma is strong and nice, fruity Belgium yeast, spices, malt and a hint of bouillon. Flavor is moderat malty, sweet, some caramel, fruity, spicy, moderate bitter and very refreshing. Nice balance and a good body with a pleasant aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden. Another nice one from Brouwerij t IJ.

Bottle at Håndverkerstuene. Thx to espenra. Deep golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is sugar, alcohol, yeast, hop. Flavour is sugar, alcohol, belgian yeast, malt, hop. full body. Nice beer.

330ml bottle to finish off a joyful evening at Håndverkerstuene. Close to clear amber in body appearance. Huge, loose, and bubbly white head. Fine aroma of herbal hops added by a fresh citrus touch. Wheat citrus in flavour supported by spices and lemon. Candy sweet backbone offset by a dry bitter finale. Good drinkability (Oslo, 15.09.2012).

33cl bottle at Håndverkerstuene, Oslo. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, flowers, fruits and Belgian yeast. Sweet, fruity and floral with a yeasty and just slightly bitter finish. Nice and easy beer for spring time, but works well in autumn too. (2012-09-15)

On bottle at Håndverkerstuene .golden color, good foam.
Good floral & fruity aromas- some honey.
Medium body & medium high complexity . Some sweetness, but Very well balanced. 
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 Golden colour non filtered medium foamy head, sweet melon like very delicate, bitter malty very dark taste with some hints of melon
Bottle. Hazy deep orange, huge foamy white head. Aroma is spicy t ij yeast, slightly malty. Flavor is bitter spicy, quite malty, yeasty and thick body. Not very outspoken, still OK.
Bottle. Color hazy orange with medium head. Aroma yeast, coriander, fruits. Taste sweet, yeast, orange, spicy.

Medium offwhite head. Hazy opaque amber body. Fruity mealy orangey aroma with spicy herbal toffee notes, with traces of oil and paper. Dry-sweet toffee and resiny fruit taste with grassy herbal spicy notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Dry fruity resiny peppery aftertaste with orangey mealy notes. Excellent! Full-flavoured and highly drinkable. Reminiscent of Westmalle Trippel. (0.33l bottle, Håndverkerstuene, Oslo.)

33cl bottle at Håndverkerstuene. Hazy golden colour with a very small white head. More witbier than Saison. Aroma is notes of wheat, belgian yeast, bread and some bananas. Flavour is slightly bitter. Notes of yeast, bread, bananas and some apples. Some citrus. Medium long aftertaste.
Cloudy amber, firm white head. Aroma isnt impressive. Taste is mostly yeasty, bit dough, bit distant bananas maybe. Bit disappointed by this beer.

Slightly hazy blond colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, malts, caramel, quite floral. Malty flavour, light sweet, quite fruity. Finish caramel, light hops.
(From 33cL bottle @ home)

Bottle. I like the name a lot. Pours out a hazy orange colour with a nice, creamy white head on top. Aroma of banana, yeast and some small peppery notes. Flavour is full, bit bitter and returns the sweetness of some banana. Has some eggy notes, like yoke or something, but that could be an expectation because of the name of the beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ The aroma is fruity, hints of apricot and banana. Pours hazy orange with a foamy white head. Head fades away leaving a thin lacing. The taste has fruit and yeast in it. The aftertaste is a bit bitter (grapefruit) with again some fruits. It's a nice one, would love to drink it again.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, light yeasty and caramelish. Fruity, peppery, yeasty and solid bitter. Mellow yeasty and dry bitter finish, lasting yeasty fruity and mild caramelish.
Cloudy, light brown, with a thick white head.  Tastes of alcohol, caramel, and fruit.  Medium body.

33cL bottle purchased at Bierkoning during my trip to Amsterdam.  BB 9/2012, consumed in October 2011, fresh for bock season in Amsterdam.  Consumed in my hotel room at room temperature.  Poured into a De Molen tuliped copita glass. Pour is dark, hazy amber.  The beer is thick with no clarity.  Has a small head that never fully fades.  Aroma starts off with some sweetness and then it is quickly overtaken by a HORRIBLE FLAW.  It is rancid aroma combined with some vomit.   Its not all vomit but more than enough,  Fortunately, the flavor is devoid of sulfur.  Its a sweet fruit esters.  I thought this was supposed to be a bock but its a Belgian ale.  Either way it is doable.  I would keep drinking it if I did not get the whiff of vomit when I take a sip.  Too hard.  I hope its an off bottle but I doubt.  I also hate to rate this with just one bottle but this was definitely a bad bad flaw.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: (33cl bottle thanks to bu11zeye) golden pour, effervescent and a creamy eggshell colored head. Nose of pineapple, candi sugar. Taste of candi sugar, bitter pine, grapefruit and other citrus. Creamy body and linger.
On draft at the brewery.  Orangish color with a nice white head.  Fruity esters.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 2011: Ugly yellow/orange colour. Smells like dirty aftershave. Taste is fruity. Palate is dry.

Rerate 2017: iron, herbs, malt, yeasty. 2.5 was a bit harsh though.
Hazy light orange color, small thick head. Musty smell, totally not nice. Something wrong in the taste. Dry finish. Good carbo, ok body.

Bottled 330ml. -Great thanks to my dear friend Maja P. for bringing this one from Amsterdam.
Cloudy orange coloured, medium sizedwhite head, spicy fruity and mild alcoholic nose. Moderate malty, yeasty, quite fruity and pleasant spicy with notes of coriander near the end. Well balanced fruity spicy and light alcoholic taste. Enjoyable beer.

On tap at Brouwerij t Ij, Amsterdam on 3 April 2011. Hazy orange/orange colour. Also has that herbal bitterness and coriander presence that I found in a number of the Ij beers. This time though its underlain by a sherbety sweetness that I didnt find so appealing.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 on tap at the Doerak, Delft.
Cloudy blond colour.  Ok white head.  Coriander in the aftertaste

Orange, obviously unfiltered. Good head. Smells quite much the same as most of super market lagers, with small amount of citrus. Taste is good. I could believe this is wheat beer. Aroma is light with some citrus again, and floral aromas. Theres bits of yeast giving some basement/mud aroma, but not much. I think Ill have this again some day.

(33cl bottle)  Pours a hazy golden body with a moderate off-white head.  Aroma of florals, nuts, coating on Spree candy, and potpourri.   Flavor of florals, yeast, subtle citrus, and coriander with a dry finish.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2011 Bottle (33 cl) from the Cracked Kettle. Murky orange, medium creamy off-white head. Fruity and slightly nutty and caramelly aroma with notes of oranges, spices, bubble gum. Medium bodied with moussy carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness. Very tasty, but I tried it alongside Zatte which is much better.

Honey gold in color with a hint of white head.  Balanced, moderately sweet in taste and aroma.

Notes: On tap at Brouwerij t Ij

Dark and clear Belgian ale and oily in texture int he mouth. Lots of yeast in the nose with grape/wine, and a heady perfume aroma. Taste is potent and bitter, with a yeasty flavour and a sour/bitter finish.

Draft. Drinks like a normal lager only with a nice body. It has very little aromas and the ones that are in this beer a pretty weak. Keep on brewing! caramel, grass, citrus, raisin, golden, orange, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, creamy, fizzy, bitter,

Bottle courtesy bu11zeye. Pours a hazy golden orange color with some light white ring of head. Aroma is barnyard, hay, sour notes, and yeast. Flavor is slightly tart with some powdery sweetness and lemon candy. Also has a bit of grass and deodorant. Good, but funky.
Intensely strong malty aroma. Powerfull sour malty with a little spice. Dry finish. A simpel harmonous stromg beer
Bottle courtesy HenrikSoegaard. Huge head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, brett, malt and hops.

Bottle. Creamy white excellent mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy very sour aroma. Moderate bitter slightly sour flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. Just as yeasty sour as most of their beers, but this has a nice balance.
25th February 2009  Cloudy gold beer. Dry palate. Intensely flavoured beer. Sour caraway malt with a little spice. Dry finish. A bit too much of the sour malt. Palate isnt great either!

330 ml bottle, courtesy 4.4-40.  Pours a cloudy, dusky, glowing orange-amber color.  A tall, thick, spongy head of off-white foam seems almost everlasting, slowly settling to a persistent blanket with ramped up edging, and leaving thick walls of solid sheet lacing behind.  Gorgeous looking brew.  The aroma kicks off with a lightly minty, wild, earthy yeast overtone, hinting on brett and barnyard.  Beneath, notes of distant tropical fruit and fresh grains are dotted with pepper and a hint of lemony bitterness.  Flavors follow suit, very Jolly Pumpkin-esque in profile, with a bretty, musty veil lightly covering the mildly sweet cereal grains and fresh pineapple and orchard fruit tones.  Good stuff.  The palate is moderate in stature, smooth, and easy going.  Carbonation is appropriately neutral, leading into a semi-dry, yeasty finish.  Another solid brew from t iJ.

Bottle, picked [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bierkoning, Amsterdam. A gusher. Some Paasij spilt whilst pouring, unfortunately.  A huge frothy white head over a cloudy pale amber, and needless to say, very lively body.  Nice Belgo-yeasty aroma, tangerine-scented with a note of bubblegum and a sour-tart fruits . Taste has a fine crispness, wheaty and dry fruity with a light sourish accent. Also  a note of  fresh yeast. Healthy body. A pleasant astringency on the palate. Finishes dry and mild fruity-tart. Another excellent brew from the Dutch pioneers.
33cl, Dutch organic Easter brew, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, complex brew, not balanced, cloudy, rocky head, nice brew

In short: A sweet yeasty blonde Belgian ale that does in many direction.  A fun mess.
How: Bottle 33ml.  Exact age unknown, probably the year before release.  Given to me by Borresteijn.  Thanks Rob.
The look: Cloudy blonde body topped by a medium white head
In long: Nose is strong, yeasty, some phenols and with an overall sweet bakery sensation like a baklava.  Taste is sweet but a little less than the nose suggested.  Crisp pie crust, caramel, candied apples, light spicy notes, light sour apple notes, bakery, various light color fruits.  There was something a bit wild about the yeast character that I liked but overall the beer is kind of here and there with no direction.  A bit messy but still fun.  This beer is a yearly Easter beer brewed to celebrate the resurrection of a bunny.

Bottle. Gold to amber coloured, white head, somewhat hazy. Aroma is fresh, oranges, tangerines (mandarijnen), peaches, sweet fruits. Tastes light bitter, with lots of carbonation. Some bitterness in the finish. Aroma is nevertheless more promising than the taste.

bottle, brought back from Amsterdam by my parents - thanks!  Pours a super hazy orange with a gigantor head that refuses to die.  Seriously amazing.  Nose is lemony bretty funk, apple skins, light honey, hay-like malt.  Flavor is yeasty phenols - general fruitiness leaning towards apple, a bit of clove, lemon candy brett, a bit of cherry pie filling.  Bitterness is solid, balancing some very nice lightly toasted malt.  Finish is slightly tingly, with lingering yeast, lemon  candy & cherry pie brett.  This brewery rocks.
Courtesy GoT. Gold pour, white carbonation. Floral, spicy, light colored fruits, signature t Ij brewery yeast with just a bit of funk. Nicely dry. Love this brewery. Thanks J!
Bottle from the brewery.  Funky aroma.  Awesome beer.  I really like it.  I wish I could get more.

Bottle from Bierkoning.
Lovely fruity and sour, Belgian style.
Huge fluffy head without any yeast. Complex, very drinkable. My favourite from this brewery.

Bottle from the brewpub. Pours hazy orange gold with a large foamy nearwhite head. Standard belgian ale smell - cooked fruit, spice and hop. Medium body with lightly foamy carbonation. Theres cooked light fruit and yeast/spice. It all goes very well together. Finishes with something like noble hop bitter. Really very tasty.
Hay, light bitterness, medium sweet aftertaste. Decent taste, with matching hazy brownish body and fairly firm foam. (Bottle 33cl)
Draft. Light brown hazy color. Sweet malty aroma. Flavor is malty at the beginning, then some hops. Aftertaste is strong and spicy. Good
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2010 Draught at Brouwerijt IJ on 20th March 2010. Hazy gold with decaying white head. Very citrusy grapefruit hit. Citric finish, smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle from De Bierkoning. Beautiful orangey amber with a big offwhite head. Spicy sweet malts with hints of brettanomyces providing balance. A very subtle amber ale that have more depth than first imagined.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2010 Bottle. Cloudy hazelish amber pour with a big creamy head. Nice!
Aroma of sweet fruits, some hops, citrus and unknown spices.
Flavour is a quite dry bitterness with some sweet fruit and yeast. Sidenote of liquorice. Nice one.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a small wehite head. Has a fruity spicy aroma with some citrus hints. Fruity spicy yeasty flavor. Has a dry malty spicy yeasty finish.
Hazy orange colour and tight, dense head. Aroma has some orange zest. A zingy freshness tries and fails to get through due to the overwhelming bitterness of this beer.

33cl bottle from Bacchanalia, Cambridge. Hazy golden amber, heavily carbonated with a billowing cream head; aroma of green fruit - apples, pears and grapes, and yeast; very tart flavour as if the hops are underripe, with some yeastiness and malts coming through. The alcohol is well masked, but gives a warming finish. Interesting, but not something Id drink regularly.

Ive had this beer a few times, but this is my first time rating it. Looks classic in the glass (a de graal tulip) nice murky orange, glows around the edges, decent carbonation, but not over the top, lovely little fluffy white head about a 1mm high. As Ive said I have had this beer and many other TIj beers and what Ive noticed is that they are good beer makers but somewhat inconsistent. There spicing goes up and down, the sweet:hop ratio changes, and thats in the same beer 2 bottles of one batch etc. Dont get me wrong, these idiosyncrasies are what make micro-breweries what they are, but when it effects the quality of the beer thats when I become concerned. Anyway what Im trying to say is this isnt the worst version of the Paasij beer Ive had but its not the best either. Its very refreshing, it feels great on the palate, but the problem is with the spicing, it gives a slightly sour aroma, and tastes a little tart from this clove-like/cinnamon type spice thats in there and possibly a little to strong in this batch leading to a very slight imbalance in my opinion overall. So picky I maybe, but I say this only as I have tasted better from this little gem of a brewery!

Nice foamy head. I dont think the 2009 is as good as the 2008. The palate is still nice and a little thick but the alcohol is a little too pronounced for my taste. I was really looking forward to this one and looked all over Amsterdam to find a bottle, but I have to say its somewhat dissappointing this year.
Bottle bought at the beerkoning in Amterdam. It is a Easter beer. A nice one. Dark orange color. Nice beer for in April.

Nice deep orange/amber coloured body with a thinnish tan head. Fresh and hoppy aroma of sour grapes and nice potent malt. Medium to Full-bodied; Strong perfumey taste with malt and some light spices coming out. Aftertaste shows malt, a lot of spice and a good grassy quality. Overall, a nice beer - definitely worth trying...good to try, and a nice full-bodied beer! I sampled this 33 cL bottle purchased from BioMarkt in Amsterdam, Holland on 27-December-2007, sampled at home on 19-January-2009 in Washington.
Bottle at home. Very nice ale. Orange colour, foamy head. Buttery, sweet taste. Hint of chocolate. Perfumey finish. Enjoyable, especially in April...

Bottled			A massive gusher of a beer.  Pours hazy copper with a large whitish head.  The aroma is lemony and yeasty with hints of spices.  Quite cakey in the mouth with a little more spice.  A nice body.  Almost warming.

Bottle 33cl.Unclear medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is fruity - acidic, moderate yeasty. Flavor is moderate sweet, light acidic and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (050808)

Bottle at GBBF with a cheese grater in one hand and a bag of banter in the other, everyone will know that The Cad knows! Alround rating: Lemon, sharp, hints of spice, but the sharp sour lemon character is really nice.

Many taps & bottles. This beer tastes a bit different every year. Cloudy golden amber colour, off-white head. Aroma of IJ yeast, sourness, acid, fruit. Flavour is sweet, very spicy, yeast, malts and a bit sour, but mostly bitter with a bittersweet finish. Full bodied. I love it.
Bottle at GBBF ...hazy yellow ... slight sour hop nose ... fruity hops and yeasty bready.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy gold, with a large beige head. Strong aroma of spices with sour, yeast and alcohol behind it- not that nice. Taste is sweet from the get-go, with sour and spices coming in the middle and finishing with a linger bitter. Almost a Hoegarden it feels to me? Lots of pepper in it as well. A complex beer, indeed.
Hazy amber with huge off white head. Sweet and sourish aroma with brett and fruity notes. Sweet flavor with brett, wood anyeasty notes and good malt base to balance it.

On tap at the brewery under the windmill, Amsterdam (3/2008).  Lasting foamy head, thick wall of lacing.  Hazy orange in the glass.  Do I smell wheat?  This is like Hoegaarden Gran Cru with banana added.  Smells of lemon grass and other grasses.  Flavor and feel is vaguely creamy, vaguely fruity, with the aforementioned banana.  Good, but not that impressive (in that it doesnt make any particular impression).

Bottle. [thank you, Skortila/Caesar]
Pours hazy yellow-orange with a big, creamy, whipped-egg-whites head. Stunning duration. Some small floaties in the liquid. Aroma is heavily yeasty, lots of biscuits, oranges, lime and fine herbs. Medium carbonation. Fine creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is nicely dry, very malty sweet, some peppery edge. Good citric bitterness. Nice beer  wonderful head. Now, Ive looked at that foam for 5 minutes, and it hasnt diminished yet!

Very hazy caramel colour with a small white head. This really isnt a good looker. Curiously herby aroma, slightly metallic, which also doesnt contribute much. The taste, rather rough and earthy, has some sour fruitiness, a definite hint of pepper, and some sharp background bitterness you hardly notice at first.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours a hazy orange with a small white head and a thick sweet aroma of fresh citrus-fruits and spices. The taste is sweet, fruity and spicey, like a more full-bodied triple. I like it!
Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy orange coloured ale with subtle sweetness and fine spices for the taste.

33cl bottle at vonks slijterij zaandam, 
full suprise! very full grainy and hoppy in the bottom, ..peach and banana in the aroma, very gentle bitter.
Im impressed.

Tap at brewery: Hazy pale orange color, big fluffy head. Big yeasty body, some banana and fruitiness. Spicy peppery end with a hint of hops. Fine balance. Big beer that stands on its own. Ive found that the IJ beers are much better on tap than in the bottle, and at the brewery they are stupendous.
Bottled. Hazy orange colour, big creamy white head. Aroma is spices, hops, some herbs and earth. Flavour is spices, earth and yeast. Some grass is also noteable. Aftertaste is grassy and earthy.

Bottled
Hazy orange color, very nice cloudy head. Very fruity aroma (dominating aroma is apricot). Very fruity mandarin flavor. Light spices, sugar and light alcohol. Great beer! Mixture of Belgian trippel and American saison.

2002 bottle, t Arendsnest. Cloudy copper. Lasting sheet of white foam tops it. Highly malty, cerealic and yeasty (cloves) nose in which light honeyed Madeira tones have started to develop. The carbonation remains most satisfying though. Uniform small bubbles with a bite. An interesting fruitiness ranging as much from apples to pears or pomegranates make the whole figure rather complex. Interesting phase of its evolution, but certainly will not improve anymore.

NR. 8, BBE March 2008. Cloudy golden body, long lasting head and good lacing. Sweet and bready aroma, malty with honey and (indeed) straw/raspberries, some other dark fruits, brown sugar, caramel, overall really sweet with nice bready malt in the background and very slight hops buried beneath. The taste was fruity, floral and citric with some spices, sweet & sour, very rounded and lush. The typical musky infected IJ thing shines through slightly but fades rapidly, leaving a nice long bready and sweet & sour finish with strawberries and lemon. Mouthfeel was medium, not much carbonation. I expected another infected bottle since thats all Im getting from t IJ lately, but this one was surprisingly good, sweet and fruity. Nice.

(Bottled) Hazy golden (opaque orange with yeast) with a smallish, but lasting head. Very tart aroma of raspberries and toffee-sourish malt. Sourish-malty flavor with dried fruit and hints of genever. With yeast theres some more fruit, but the change is not very noticeable. Medium-bodied, dryish and tart palate with foamy but quite low carbonation. A drinkable, tart and pleasant, but not very complex easter brew.

Golden, hazy with a nice, white head. The aroma is slightly unpleasant with musty, earthy notes and yeast. The flavour luckily only has a bit of the same, and it has notes of yeast, fruit, coriander and a clear grapefruit note in the finish. Complex - and special.

Tap at T´Ij, march 07. Earthy, spicy, fruity aroma. Profound coriander flavor and an earthy, minerally, salty ending, which blends very well with the spice. MF is medium, full spice, salty mineral feeling and a strange mineral/dry aftertaste. Hazy orange-golden color with a dense, creamy and lasting white head. A nice, quaffing, delectable spiced strong pale ale.

The final beer of my Low Countries vacation. Sour fruit and citrus in the aroma.  A cloudy yellow beer.  Flavor has some malt, but this is more sour than anything else.  Acidic finish.  Like everything from this brewery, it is kind of weird but I like it.

Bottle.
Clear golden coloured with a creamy off white head.
Aroma of fruits, yeast, leather and spices.
Flavour of fruits, yeast, leather and spices.
Bottle. Golden colour with a big white head. Sweet malty, yeasty, perfumed aroma and taste. Medium body with a perfumed finish. Strange beer.
Very good, and the artwork is interesting. Maybe it was a little Vintage since the season is not this one. Prooves that the Dutch can brew too. The colour is a little orange and good.

Poured a hazy golden color with a large off-white head.  The aroma was sweet and yeasty with notes of lemon and citrus.  Light leather notes as well.  The flavor was sweet with some fruitiness.  Yeasty notes.  Lively mouthfeel.

A Mes rate: 
Sweet delicate aroma with lots of malt and wheat. Sweet flavour with quite a lot of alcohol and almost wine like notes (white grapes). Palate is unusual with a very noticeable tarty zing at the sides. Tart and almost acidic finish.
Pours a hazy dark amber with creamy, velvety head. Aroma of apple and cinnamon. Spicy and smooth, excellent Easter brew.
Dark murky yellow. Smells hoppy. Tastes like a carnival, tasty and sweet. Refreshing and charming.

(Bottle 33 cl) Beautiful, dark golden, quite hazy with floating impurities. Dense, retentive head. Has an odd not so pleasant aroma, but this doesnt spill into the flavour. Very, very delicious almost perfumy flavours without being very sweet - or bitter for that matter. Actually very harmonious. This is how an Easter brew should be made. 190203

Pours unclear golden and a big foamy white head. Dominating yeast aroma with perfume characters and light spices. Yeast and hay flavor with plenty of fruit such as citrus and notes of white pepper. Rather sweet, has a candied touch to it. Dry and biding, but still a soft mouthfeel. Very nice and quite different.

Another present from Amsterdam. Hazy amber , big frothy white head, good steady bead. Clean, spicy aroma, typical white beer style. Palate isnt overly spicy, but stiil distinctive, l.o.n.g lasting finish, similar to Hoegaarden White but with a bit more body, nice beer, cant say I notice the 7% alcohol...nice!

nice one! aromatic apricot and flowery smelling beer.tastes also flowery(perfume like) and fruity. mf is mediocre and rests in the mouth. finish is lingering, sticky sweet and bitter. one good ij brew!

Bottle. Fruity, flowery, yeasty aroma. Orange, golden colour, quite some floaties. The head is big, white and creamy, nice and stable. Nice full flavour, a little sweet. Hint of tea. Nice bitter aftertaste. Full mouthfeel. Carbonation could be softer, though.

Bottle. Warm golden with large white head. Nice lace. Fruity-sweet (peach), honey, yeast, bread, coriander, lightly tart, dry-ish finish. Soft, creamy mouthfeel, medium-full body. Complex and highly drinkable. Thanks again Jbrus.
Orange colour with a light haze and a white head. Malty sweet aroma with spices and yeast. Lots of yeast in the flavor along with a touch of fruit. Spicy dry finish.
Draught, a dense gold color with a sweet pale malt flavor, soft mouthfeel and clean finish. Very mellow spices.

An unclear orange beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of yeast and coriander. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of yeast and lesser notes of caramel, orange, coriander, and other spices. It prickles the tongue, and has a dry end.

Bottle  Hazy, orange body.  Off-white rocky head, mostly lasting.  Spare lace.  Hops and yeast (lightly) in the aroma.  Lightly bitter, lightly sweet initial flavour.  Moderately bitter finish.  Very well-balanced, lovely beer.
Hazy golden coloured. Fruity and yeasty aroma. Sweet flavour with fruity and yeasty notes. Quite soft mouthfeel.
This beer is not really good. Not well-balanced. Too much yeast dominates the finish. Flavour is thin and watery.
On tap at the brewery in Amsterdam. Creamy mouthfeel. Cake mixture aroma, and some of that in the flavour too, coupled with some wheaty bitterness. Extremely tasty, like a slightly malty Weizen Bock.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2006 Hazy golden beer, creamy white head. Slightly sweet taste, some fruits, vanilla and coriander. Creamy texture, and low carbonationlevel, makes it very easy to drink. Nice beer.
Bottled version, exp date March 02: Cloudy maize coloured beer with a large soapy white head. Aroma of wood, yoghurt and rotting maize. Very sour taste, lactic, nearly undrinkable: 7 4 3 2 4 20
Bottled version: exp date March 00. Clear foxy amber coloured beer, small white head. Sweet honeyish nose, caramel, malts. Sweet woody taste, heneyish, but salmiac in the background. IJ-ish sour. Taste is a bit weak but pleasant. Quite remarkable difference with the other old bottle. 8 4 7 3 14 36

Rating on top is the rating of a fresh Paasij on draught.
A bit like a wheat beer but with more body, a quite nice and easy-drinkable spring-beer with some coriander and fruits in the taste.

Bottle. Quite a spicy, flowery aroma, yeasty, like a lot of their other beers, this is quite soft though, some peppery floral bitterness, also slightly acidic, shares the same sort of house character as other tIJ beers, quite nice.

Bottled: Dark golden coloured. Off white lasting head. Fruits, spices and yeast in the nose. Quite pleasant. Taste is spicy, malty and fruity. Is rather thin in the end, but pleasant and easy drinkable.

Nice name again if you considder the name of the brewery.
The color is cloudy yellow-orange, with a nice foamy head. The flavor is malty, and spicy. The use of coriander is well balanced in this beer. The malts are still traceable, the yeasts and hopps too. Although it's no springbok in my opinion it's a nice beer.

In dutch Paas means "Easter" and Ij means "egg". I would consider this beer a saison if it where sour/tart and from Belgium, since it is not I would classify it as a "Spring Seasonal". Golden to yellow in color with a dense white head that lingers through the end of the glass. The flavor and mouthfeel are both very soft and mellow. There is an almost saline like silkiness. I detect a slight hint of lavendar in the aroma, however it could just be my imagination. At 7% abv, overall PaasIj is a wonderfully balanced beer that can be sipped and savoured all day long on a brisk spring afternoon.

cloudy orange colour, fine head and a nice lacing, strong bread aroma, estery, spicy, light perfumy and sweeties-like, very creamy, full and bitter with a dry yeasty finish - I just love this brewery !
Bottled. Cloudy dark orange apperance. Strong yeasty flowery aroma. Sweet with sharp, spicy flowery flavour. Ann odd one.
Bit honey, yeasty aroma. Yellow orange coloured, cloudy. Lasting head. Taste is like an interesting combination of honey and pepper. More bitter palate. Okay.
Cloudy bronze/orange in colour with a head that stays til the end.  The body is caramel and fruit with spiciness.  Quite an amalgamation of a wheat beer and abbey strong ale.  I liked it.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 Malty, hoppy, flowery aroma. Butter, honey and a touch of soap. Very hoppy flavot with honey, butter and citrus. Just a bit tart. Long hopbitter finish. Absolutely delicious!

tasted 12 years later. Bottle. Deep golden color. Pleasant floral citric, slightly yeasty aroma. Malty sweet flavor floral with some confit tropical fruit. Slightly alcoholic. Good beer.
Spicy seasonal beer. Has it at the brewery itself. I like it but it is not as good as Zatte. It is a little too hoppy.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2005 This Easter brew is one of the best Dutch beers Ive had, even if the style  isnt my definite favourite. Had it on tap in Amsterdam, very enjoyable indeed. Pleasant spicy aroma with hints of leather and wood, the yeast is not as dominant as with some other beers of this style. Some sweetness in flavour and aftertaste, but not too much. Apparently this is a "you either like it or you dont"-beer.
Sweet and spicy.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 New rerate 2014: Tap @ cafe Derat, small sample. Almost clear golden color, medium head. Aroma of spicy yeast, some coriander, bit grainy malt, hint of bubblegum. Bit bitter, bit sweet. Refreshing blonde beer. My earlier ratings showed obvious signs of infection, which t IJ used to cope with a lot. Nowadays they have it under control a bit more. Ok brew.
Rerate: Copper color, short but lasting head. Aroma of sweet flowers, bit yeasty. Taste of sweet malts, butter, bubblegum. Remaining palate. Odd t IJ brew. 1.9
Original rating: The sourness is dominant in this beer. Like the label says (you probably cant read cos its dutch) luxury nature beer of high fermentation, in which luxurious i cant apply, but the naturebeer thing is way too dominant, and i just dont like it.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2003 I tried this beer about two years ago and i thought it was terrible. However, as i found out my tastebuds do mature (i really like Flemish Sour Ales right now) i thought it was time to give this Paasij a second chance. Nevertheless, my rating remains unaltered. Very sweet and yeasty. There's a bit the same going on as in their IJndejaars brew, it's something i can't put my finger on but i really, really dislike it. I'll stick to drinking Struis, Zatte and Plzen.
